Checklists can serve as a guide for the installation team, reducing the risk of missed steps or errors, and facilitating efficient and uniform work across the entire project.

questions.question_text: Gary is program manager for his organization. His current program is over budget and is slipping on the program schedule. Management has demanded a change to the program scope. What is the most likely type of change management would make to this program scope?

discussion.content:
B. A change to reduce the program scope.

When a program is over budget and slipping on the schedule, a common approach to bring it back on track is to reduce its scope. This means scaling back on some deliverables, features, or requirements in order to align the program with the available budget and time constraints. Reducing the scope can help in managing costs and making the schedule more achievable.
